poem:
The Rate's Rhythm  
  
Within the quiet chambers,  
a fractional turn—  
one quarter measure,  
spins the world anew.  
  
Rachel's ledger arches,  
a bridge over figures.  
The bank whispers,  
yet inflation lingers,  
  
like a ghost, perched  
near the 2% threshold—  
a dream, delayed,  
flickering through which  
we must tread.
